t: “Come,*pn all you who are thirsty, come*ld to the waters; and*ln you who have no money, come,*ld buy and eat! Come,*ln buy wine and milk without*ld money and without cost.
Why*ln spend money on what is not bread, and*ld your labor on what does not satisfy? Listen,*ln listen to me, and eat what is good, and*ld you will delight in the richest of fare.
Give*ln ear and come to me; listen,*ld that you may live. I*ln will make an everlasting covenant with you, my*ld faithful love promised to David.
See,*ln I have made him a witness to the peoples, a*ld ruler and commander of the peoples.

Surely*ln you will summon nations you know not, and*ld nations you do not know will come running to you, because*ln of the Lord*s your God, the*ld Holy One of Israel, for*ld he has endowed you with splendor.”
Seek*pn the Lord*s while he may be found; call*ld on him while he is near.
Let*ln the wicked forsake their ways and*ld the unrighteous their thoughts. Let*ln them turn to the Lord,*s and he will have mercy on them, and*ld to our God, for he will freely pardon.
“For*pn my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither*ld are your ways my ways,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“As*pn the heavens are higher than the earth, so*ld are my ways higher than your ways and*ld my thoughts than your thoughts.

As*ln the rain and the snow come*ld down from heaven, and*ln do not return to it without*ld watering the earth and*ln making it bud and flourish, so*ld that it yields seed for the sower and bread for the eater,
so*ln is my word that goes out from my mouth: It*ld will not return to me empty, but*ln will accomplish what I desire and*ld achieve the purpose for which I sent it.
You*ln will go out in joy and*ld be led forth in peace; the*ln mountains and hills will*ld burst into song before you, and*ln all the trees of the field will*ld clap their hands.
Instead*ln of the thornbush will grow the juniper, and*ld instead of briers the myrtle will grow. This*ln will be for the Lord’s*s renown, for*ld an everlasting sign, that*ld will endure forever.”
